intro: Gasteria brevifolia, commonly known as the dwarf gasteria, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features rosettes of thick, fleshy, dark green leaves with a waxy texture. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for dry environments. Its compact size and unique appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
